text: so let's talk about today's task force
report Prime Minister inadequate
provision worsening outcomes and
increase in the number of people
committing suicide that's the verdict of
the Task Force on mental health since
2011 why do you allow this to happen
since you've been Prime Minister well is
a very powerful report and it shows how
much more we need to do it's great
damning but it tells us what we need to
do and yes we should be frank you know
we've not done enough to end the stigma
of mental health that we focused a lot
on physical health and we haven't as a
country as a nation focused enough on
mental health that is changing let's
talk about a specific case which I know
you you're aware of which is the case of
Edmond and the son of Steve Mallon who
wrote to you his 18 year old son
presented as a clear suicide risk was
given a strip of pills and a couple of
website addresses and very shortly
afterwards he took his own life can you
pledge that by the end of your tenure as
prime minister there won't be a lack of
care for young people like Edward well
cause I can't pledge that there won't be
tragic events like that because there
will be but what I can balute what I
what I can pledge is that we're going to
expand for instance the talking
therapies that I think that have been so
valuable for so many people and the
money is there for that as I've said
three quarters of a million more people
already accessing talking therapies for
the first time ever waiting lists
waiting times rather so if for instance
you have psychosis you should get
treatment within two weeks when you say
two weeks the average waiting time for a
child to get access to therapy is 32
weeks it's far too long and that's why
we're putting in the money but as I said
not just money it's also saying let's
have we're very familiar with a waiting
time targets for physical health you
know you shouldn't have to wait longer
than 18 weeks for your treatment when I
doing that for mental health as well the

you pledge that that will happen I we
can only pledge what we can afford I
don't know that I can make that specific
pledge and I don't want to say something
on your program that I can't deliver
let's talk about another recommendation
the task force report which is to end
the situation where
children and adults are sent out of the

to get to an acute psychiatric bed when
they are in crisis the taskforce report
recommends that that system be ended by
2021 will that happen again we accept
the report that's what we want to see
happen at the moment people are having
to travel too far if you look at for
instance children and the mental health
bed provision there's actually more bed
provision than there's been in the past
but we're also seeing frankly more
children presenting with mental health
problems if you look for instance at
eating disorders we've seen a big
increase in those extra money and extra
work needs to be done
but yes we accept what's in the report
now we've got to work out have we got

because I've put two of the

are you actually going to force you're
going to spend a billion pounds extra
per year over the coming period in order
to deliver a million more treatments and
we're going to go through this report
and as we respond to the report we'll be
